name: v0.0.37: Fix the build + python3
body: At this point, it seems not worth the trouble to support python2, since I couldn't figure out how to fix the build and retain python 2 support.

name: Update subpar dependency
body: * Update subpar dependency (2018-03-07)

name: v0.0.35: Support cache
body: * Support caching downloaded image layers

name: Various updates
body:
- Replace --platform in pullers with specific args
- Use custom docker client config directory
- Fix bazel dependencies

name: Various updates
body:
- Save manifest and digest when downloading image
- Allow specifying platform
- Update httplib2 dependency

name: v0.0.32: Bugfix
body: * Fix bug in image digester

name: v0.0.31: Tool to get image digest + Bugfix
body:
* Tool to get image digest
* Fix rules_docker #474
* Fix bug in tarball manifest LayerSource

name: v0.0.30: Bugfix
body:
* Fix bug from v0.0.29 in computing diffid
* Make FromDisk work with foreign layers

name: v0.0.29: Foreign layers
body: * Add support for foreign layers, including parsing LayerSources in tarball manifests.

name: v0.0.28: python3
body:
This is a pretty big change, but *seems* to work in our testing.

Good luck, dependents.

name: v0.0.27: Various fixes
body:
* Allow "access_token" in token response.
* Attempt to mount layers from src repo in tools/docker_appender.
* Fix bad error messages involving `docker_name`s with __repr_

name: v0.0.26: Fix manifest list pulling
body:
* `docker_puller` and `fast_puller` will now default to amd64/linux when pulling a manifest list.
  * Fixes bazelbuild/rules_docker#320

name: Bugfixes
body:
* account for "RepoTags":null in manifest.json
* Make fatal event return non-zero exit codes from the dockerless tools.
  * Fixes: bazelbuild/rules_docker#314
* Improve error message when cred helper not found

name: v0.0.24: Various fixes
body:
* Add support for uncompressed image layers. Update fast_flatten to use it.
* Remove unnecessary `--output_base` bazel flag.
* Raise a more descriptive error when a /v2/ registry ping fails.
* Log errors on exceptions in the push/pull tools, rather than crash with a stack trace.
* Add additional validation for docker_name.Registries
* Add docker_name.from_string() function.
* Fix thread safety issue with retry_transport factory.

name: v0.0.23: Transport fixes
body:
* Handle relative URLs for location returned by blob endpoints (fixes wcr.io).
* Allow insecure registries for ".locahost" tld.
* Add http transport level retries for retryable errors.

name: v0.0.22: Various Fixes
body:
This fixes a bug that was reported using the library against the Sonatype OSS Docker registry.

This also fixes a bug that was reported using the library under Python3.

name: v0.0.21: Fix overrides
body: This release fixes a problem in the appender where sometimes multiple entries would be added to the config's history.

name: v0.0.20: Import uncompressed layers
body: This changes the fast importer to import uncompressed tarballs from the `docker save`-format tarball to take advantage of the fact that `container_load` now supports receiving uncompressed tarballs.

name: v0.0.18: Switch to requirements.txt for dependencies
body: This migrates dependencies from direct `WORKSPACE` references to URLs to using the new `rules_python` support for `pip` packages and `requirements.txt`.

name: v0.0.17 Fix Labels
body: This fixes the "Labels" metadata field that was improperly singular before.

name: Appender.par release #2
body: Also some fixes around digest calculation and timestamps.

name: Appender.par release
body: This release contains a new standalone appender.par tool, as well as various fixes around OCI compatibility.

name: v0.0.14: Assorted Fixes
body: This release contains assorted fixes, including passing scheme to credential helpers.

name: v0.0.13: Support Basic Authentication
body: This PR adds support for Basic authentication, which is needed for Amazon's container registry, and certain configurations of `registry:2`.

name: v0.0.12 Faaaast push/pull
body:
This release contains BREAKING changes to the puller/pusher in support of a more efficient on-disk format in `bazelbuild/rules_docker`.

The new puller takes a `--directory` argument and emits the constituent elements as files under this directory as described in `save.fast`.

The new pusher is backwards-compatible, but the `--tarball` argument is used only for accepting a legacy base image on which the new intermediate format builds.  The new layers and their digests are passed through repeated `--layer` and `--digest` arguments, in the order in which they should appear in the image's manifest.  The v2.2 config file for the new image is passed via `--config`.

name: v0.0.11 Stamping
body: This adds support for Bazel stamping to the docker_pusher tool.

name: v0.0.10 Fix credential helper support
body: This fixes the credential helper handshake when the helper is asked about a registry domain for which it has no credentials.

name: v0.0.9 Fix local registry support
body: This fixes a final issue due to a bad assumption about the "empty layer"s availability when converting images between formats.

name: v0.0.8 rules_docker fixes
body: This release contains various fixes for issues uncovered by users of `bazelbuild/rules_docker`.

name: v0.0.7: Flexible docker_name
body: This allows users of `docker_name` to relax some of its strict requirements around specifying fully-qualified tag, digest, repository.

name: v0.0.6: Support pushing to yet more registries
body: This release switches us to using POST/PATCH/PUT uploads, which work with Bintray.

name: v0.0.5: Support pushing to more registries
body: This release changes the method used for uploading layer blobs to the POST/PUT method because the monolithic POST method isn't widely supported.

name: v0.0.4: Optimizations for docker_build
body:
This release contains numerous optimizations for dealing with images whose underlying representation is uncompressed (e.g. `FromTarball`).  This is mostly for scenarios where those layers are destined to be stored uncompressed (e.g. `save.py`).

The primary scenario it targets is Bazel `docker_build` which significantly regressed going through our compressed abstractions, but with this release and some forthcoming changes it should be comparable to the version bundled with Bazel previously.

name: v0.0.3: Supporting Bazel's docker_build
body: This release contains all of the supporting changes needed to migrate Bazel's docker_build to use this library for it's metadata and tarball manipulations (in addition to relying on this for pusher/puller).

name: v0.0.2
body: Adds a dependency on "six" to fix problems running the released PAR files in some environments.

name: v0.0.1
body: Initial release of the `google/containerregistry` client library.

name: v0.0.0-test
body: Initial test release of `google/containerregistry` to verify that the binary release triggers are WAI.
